meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'kore', referring to a type of ancient Greek statue of a young woman.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, the kores stood gracefully, showcasing the beauty of ancient art.
meanings.sent2: The kores in the exhibit were admired for their delicate features and elegant poses.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actors pretended to be living kores, bringing laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her movements on stage were as fluid and captivating as a group of kores coming to life.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight illuminated the kores, making them appear almost lifelike in the gallery.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'kore', meaning to gather or collect.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, she kores fresh flowers from her garden to brighten up the house.
meanings.sent2: He always kores seashells during his beach walks as souvenirs of his travels.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to kores nuts with such determination, amusing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the wind seemed to kores all the fallen leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: The children eagerly kores colorful stones along the riverbank, their pockets filling up quickly.
